children.name: ReferenceReferenceBuilder(InternalRelationshipBuilder)
children.summary:
<para>
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceReferenceBuilder"></xref> class.
</para>
<para>
Instances of this class are returned from methods when using the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.ModelBuilder"></xref> API
and it is not designed to be directly constructed in your application code.
</para>

syntax.content.vb: Public Sub New(builder As InternalRelationshipBuilder)

parameters.description: The internal builder being used to configure this relationship.

children.name: ReferenceReferenceBuilder(InternalRelationshipBuilder, ReferenceReferenceBuilder, Boolean, Boolean, Boolean, Boolean)
children.summary:
<para>
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceReferenceBuilder"></xref> class.
</para>

syntax.content: protected ReferenceReferenceBuilder(InternalRelationshipBuilder builder, ReferenceReferenceBuilder oldBuilder, bool inverted = false, bool foreignKeySet = false, bool principalKeySet = false, bool requiredSet = false)
syntax.content.vb: Protected Sub New(builder As InternalRelationshipBuilder, oldBuilder As ReferenceReferenceBuilder, inverted As Boolean = False, foreignKeySet As Boolean = False, principalKeySet As Boolean = False, requiredSet As Boolean = False)

parameters.description: The internal builder being used to configure this relationship.

type.name: ReferenceReferenceBuilder
type.summary:
<para>
Provides a simple API for configuring a one-to-one relationship.
</para>
<para>
If multiple reference key properties are specified, the order of reference key properties should
match the order that the primary key or unique index properties were configured on the principal
entity type.
</para>

syntax.content.vb: Public Class ReferenceReferenceBuilder Implements IInfrastructure(Of IMutableModel), IInfrastructure(Of InternalRelationshipBuilder)

parameters.description: A value indicating whether to reverse the direction of the relationship.
A value indicating whether the foreign key properties have been configured in this chain of configuration calls.
A value indicating whether the principal key properties have been configured in this chain of configuration calls.
A value indicating whether required/optional has been configured in this chain of configuration calls.

children.name: IInfrastructure<IMutableModel>.Instance
children.summary: The model that this relationship belongs to.

syntax.content.vb: ReadOnly WriteOnly Property Microsoft.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.IInfrastructure<Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IMutableModel>.Instance As IMutableModel Implements IInfrastructure(Of IMutableModel).Instance

type.name: IMutableModel
type.summary:
<para>
Metadata about the shape of entities, the relationships between them, and how they map to the database. A model is typically
created by overriding the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.DbContext.OnConfiguring(Microsoft.Data.Entity.DbContextOptionsBuilder)"></xref> method on a derived context, or
using <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.ModelBuilder"></xref>.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IModel"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

children.name: IInfrastructure<InternalRelationshipBuilder>.Instance
children.summary: Gets the internal builder being used to configure this relationship.

syntax.content.vb: ReadOnly WriteOnly Property Microsoft.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.IInfrastructure<Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Internal.InternalRelationshipBuilder>.Instance As InternalRelationshipBuilder Implements IInfrastructure(Of InternalRelationshipBuilder).Instance

children.name: HasAnnotation(String, Object)
children.summary:
Adds or updates an annotation on the relationship. If an annotation with the key specified in

already exists it's value will be updated.

syntax.content: public virtual ReferenceReferenceBuilder HasAnnotation(string annotation, object value)
syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function HasAnnotation(annotation As String, value As Object) As ReferenceReferenceBuilder

parameters.description: The key of the annotation to be added or updated.
The value to be stored in the annotation.

type.name: ReferenceReferenceBuilder
type.summary:
<para>
Provides a simple API for configuring a one-to-one relationship.
</para>
<para>
If multiple reference key properties are specified, the order of reference key properties should
match the order that the primary key or unique index properties were configured on the principal
entity type.
</para>

syntax.content.vb: Public Class ReferenceReferenceBuilder Implements IInfrastructure(Of IMutableModel), IInfrastructure(Of InternalRelationshipBuilder)

return.description: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.

children.name: HasForeignKey(String, String[])
children.summary:
<para>
Configures the property(s) to use as the foreign key for this relationship.
</para>
<para>
If the specified property name(s) do not exist on the entity type then a new shadow state
property(s) will be added to serve as the foreign key. A shadow state property is one
that does not have a corresponding property in the entity class. The current value for the
property is stored in the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.ChangeTracking.ChangeTracker"></xref> rather than being stored in instances
of the entity class.
</para>
<para>
If <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceReferenceBuilder.HasPrincipalKey(System.Type,System.String[])"></xref> is not specified, then an attempt will be made to
match the data type and order of foreign key properties against the primary key of the principal
entity type. If they do not match, new shadow state properties that form a unique index will be
added to the principal entity type to serve as the reference key.
</para>

syntax.content: public virtual ReferenceReferenceBuilder HasForeignKey(string dependentEntityTypeName, params string[] foreignKeyPropertyNames)
syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function HasForeignKey(dependentEntityTypeName As String, ParamArray foreignKeyPropertyNames As String()) As ReferenceReferenceBuilder

parameters.description: The name of the entity type that is the dependent in this relationship (the type that has the foreign key properties).
The name(s) of the foreign key property(s).

type.name: ReferenceReferenceBuilder
type.summary:
<para>
Provides a simple API for configuring a one-to-one relationship.
</para>
<para>
If multiple reference key properties are specified, the order of reference key properties should
match the order that the primary key or unique index properties were configured on the principal
entity type.
</para>

children.name: HasForeignKey(Type, String[])
children.summary:
<para>
Configures the property(s) to use as the foreign key for this relationship.
</para>
<para>
If the specified property name(s) do not exist on the entity type then a new shadow state
property(s) will be added to serve as the foreign key. A shadow state property is one
that does not have a corresponding property in the entity class. The current value for the
property is stored in the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.ChangeTracking.ChangeTracker"></xref> rather than being stored in instances
of the entity class.
</para>
<para>
If <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceReferenceBuilder.HasPrincipalKey(System.Type,System.String[])"></xref> is not specified, then an attempt will be made to
match the data type and order of foreign key properties against the primary key of the principal
entity type. If they do not match, new shadow state properties that form a unique index will be
added to the principal entity type to serve as the reference key.
</para>

return.description: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.

children.name: HasPrincipalKey(String, String[])
children.summary: Configures the unique property(s) that this relationship targets. Typically you would only call this method if you want to use a property(s) other than the primary key as the principal property(s). If the specified property(s) is not already a unique constraint (or the primary key) then a new unique constraint will be introduced.

syntax.content: public virtual ReferenceReferenceBuilder HasPrincipalKey(string principalEntityTypeName, params string[] keyPropertyNames)
syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function HasPrincipalKey(principalEntityTypeName As String, ParamArray keyPropertyNames As String()) As ReferenceReferenceBuilder

The name(s) of the reference key property(s).
